title: What are the advantages of using threads?
body:
If a GUI application needs to perform a long, CPU-intensive task, spinning a background thread is an easy way to do so without freezing the GUI.

In a service-type application, you can have multiple threads serving multiple clients, one thread per client, so that server time is shared more or less equally between clients.

In an input/output heavy application, while one thread is waiting for a disk/network operation to complete (assuming the operation is blocking), another thread can do something useful.

On a machine with multiple CPUs or CPU cores, which is pretty much every desktop, laptop, server, tablet, and smartphone these days, several threads can execute on different CPU cores at the same time, gaining extra performance.

For all those scenarios, manual scheduling and context switching is theoretically possible, but it's a pain in the neck to implement, and modern operating systems already provide an implementation in shape of threads.
